statementHtml: Find the CDF of a discrete random variable X that takes values {0, 1} with probabilities {0.4, 0.6}.
hints: Think about the probability mass function (PMF)
solutionHtml:
We can calculate the CDF by summing up the PMF values for all x ≤ x:

\n
  • For x = 0: \(F(0) = P(X=0) = 0.4\)
  • For x > 0: \(F(x) = P(X \leq x) = P(X=0) + P(X=1) = 0.4 + 0.6 = 1\)
",
answerShort: The CDF is F(0) = 0.4 and F(x) = 1 for x > 0" },

steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Calculate the PMF", "mathHtml": "\(P(X=0) = 0.3\)", "explanation": "We start by finding the probability mass function (PMF)" }, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Find the CDF for x = 0", "mathHtml": "\(F(0) = P(X=0) = 0.3\)", "explanation": "For x = 0, we sum up the PMF values" }, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Find the CDF for x > 0", "mathHtml": "\(F(x) = P(X \leq x) = P(X=0) + P(X=1) = 0.3 + 0.7 = 1\)", "explanation": "For x > 0, we sum up the PMF values for all x ≤ x" }, {"stepNumber": 4, "description": "Combine the results", "mathHtml": "\(F(x) = \begin{cases} 0.3 & x=0 \\ 1 & x>0 \end{cases}\)", "explanation": "We combine the results to get the final CDF" } ],
finalAnswer: The CDF is F(0) = 0.3 and F(x) = 1 for x > 0" },
